column5: Got out today but it's been quite a while since my last adventure.  All reports I heard was bad so I was not overly optimistic.  There was a west wind about 15 km pretty much all day---All the locals keep tellin me I need to fish heavy in the weeds this time of year---tried it for a bit and watched them and me catchin zip.  Sooo I tapped into the experience files and caught fish----windblown rocky points---anywhere from 12-17 fow---I was fishin for food today---funny thing---I'm by myself (or with all my friends)and I could only keep one walleye over 18 inches---1st one I caught 20 1/2---never caught anything all day under 18--so I brought home 1 fish---closest I got was 19 inches--oh well it was fun.  Bait of choice today---perch coloured spinners and worms.  Here's your livewell shot.
Sounds like a great day out.  Nice fish and thanks for sharing.
Nice walter Terry Good job.... sounds like you had fun once you were able to locate them Thanks for sharing Jacques
Great stuff Bushy....lol...ripping weeds is overated. GO DEEP OR GO HOME!
Thanks Limey---I read your last report---made me kinda homesick for Ole Lightning Lake----I fished many times right where you was
